description:
The Young@Hear 
Jan 12, 2010


The Young@Heart Chorus, a group composed of New England senior citizens, has delighted audiences worldwide with renditions of songs by artists from The Clash to Coldplay. YOUNG@HEART chronicles seven weeks in the lives of the members of the chorus as they prepare for a one-night-only concert in their hometown of Northampton, Massachusetts. The group is made up of two dozen spirited seniors ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ former schoolteachers, executives, doctors, and food service workers ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ who specialize in reinterpreting rock, punk, and R&B classics from a unique perspective. What ultimately emerges in the film is a funny and unexpectedly moving testament to friendship, creative inspiration, and expectations defied.

Led by Bob Cilman, their demanding musical director, the retirees are rehearsing their new show, struggling with Sonic YouthÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s dissonant rock anthem ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œSchizophrenia,ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ and giving new meaning to James BrownÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œI Feel Good.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ With less than two months to go until the concert, the performers grapple with new lyrics and unfamiliar melodies. During their thrice-weekly rehearsals, they gradually take possession of music ranging from R&B classics like Allen ToussaintÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œYes We Can CanÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ to ColdplayÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s emotionally powerful ballad ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œFix You,ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ upending assumptions about old age, love, sex, and death.

From 92-year-old Eileen HallÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s rousing rendition of The ClashÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œShould I Stay or Should I Go?ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ to 75-year-old Pat LindermeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s moving interpretation of PrinceÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œNothing Compares 2 U,ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ each performance responds to the ravages of age with startling emotional depth. And, after almost two months of shooting, the Young@Heart Chorus delivers a triumphant performance that celebrates the joy of music and the lives of their lost friends. The end result is an inspirational journey with a singular group of people who may be old in body, but refuse to grow old in spirit.
